title: EBSI Verifiable Trust Model
description: Base schema to manage trust model

type.description: Defines the Verifiable Credential type. MUST contain VerifiableTrustModel

credentialSubject.description: Defines additional information about the subject that is described by the Verifiable Accreditation

id.description: Defines the DID of the subject that is described by the issued credential

reservedAttributeId.description: Defines the Trusted Issuers Registry attributeId this Verifiable Accreditation has been reserved for

permissionFor.description: Defines a list of claims that define/determine the authorisation of an subject to issue or accredit certain types of VCs

schemaId.description: Schema, registered in Trusted Schemas Registry, which the accredited organisation is allowed to issue or accredit

anyOf.description: Defines the jurisdiction for which the accreditation is valid
Defines the jurisdictions for which the accreditation is valid

credentialStatus.description: Defines revocation details for the issued credential. Further redefined by type extension

id.description: Credential status in Trusted Issuers Registry, pointing towards Subject DID and the reservedAttributeId

trustFrameworkPolicy.description: Defines Trust Framework Policy under which the Verifiable Credential has been issued

type.description: Type of the TermsOfUse entry. It MUST be TrustFrameworkPolicy. Other types may be added in the future

policyId.description: URI identifying the policy under which the Trust Framework operates or Verifiable Accreditation has been Issued in

legalBasis.description: Legal basis for the tf, is a string as 'professional qualifications directive'

accreditationPolicy.description: Defines the Accreditation Policy under which the Verifiable Credential has been issued

type.description: Type of the TermsOfUse entry. It MUST be AccreditationPolicy

parentAccreditation.description: URL to access the parent entity in the trust chain supporting the attestation

rootAuthorisation.description: URL to access the root entity in the trust chain supporting the attestation
